snippet.title: Bring your portfolio: creative courses beckon
snippet.content:
Not keen on studying business and finance? Don't see medicine, IT or 4000-word essays in the tea leaves? The creative arts industry employs more than 600,000 people and generates billions in annual exports.Photo: Supplied Dr. Clive Harrison, deputy director of academic affairs at the Australian Institute of Music (AIM), says many HSC graduates want more than "dry science" and an educational shift is needed in response to student thinking. "Students want to build a future that includes imagination, creativity, and societal conscience," Harrison says. "We should redress the imbalanced focus on traditional STEM courses by delivering STEAM." The 'A' is for arts.Photo: Supplied If you're not sure what paths creative study can take and want to know more, get a long to an open day in August-September. AIM has classical and contemporary music, composition, music production, audio, music theatre, entertainment arts management and dramatic arts courses. Open day at AIM's Sydney campus includes music workshops and masterclasses, performances and a Q&A with industry experts and alumni.
Saturday August 12, 10am-3pm, Surry Hills.

NIDA Thinking acting, costume, design, radio or staging? Meet educators, tour performance and rehearsal spaces, find out about bachelor and diploma courses, application processes and what to expect if you're accepted. Wednesday August 16, 6-9pm, Kensington. SCA Smart Bachelor of Visual Arts degree candidates go to Sydney College of the Arts' August open day, get advice on how to develop a portfolio, then return for October's portfolio day armed with fabulous creations. Saturday August 26, 9am-4pm; Saturday October 7, 10am - 1pm, Sydney University. National Art School Visit the NAS' historic sandstone grounds to learn about courses in ceramics, photomedia, painting, printmaking, drawing, art history, theory, and more. Talk to lecturers about the interview and portfolio application process for a Bachelor of Fine Art degree or short courses. Saturday September 2, 10am- 4pm, Darlinghurst. SAE Sydney Explore options for audio, animation, games design, film, web and mobile, talk to educators and tour SAE's recording studios, editing suites, labs and the studio with cyclorama soundstage. Saturday August 5, 11am-3pm, Chippendale. AFTRS Future directors, producers and scriptwriters can go behind the scenes, undertake virtual tours and speak with lecturers about the Bachelor of Arts Screen degree. Saturday, August 12, 10am-3pm, Moore Park. JMC Academy Music, audio, animation, game design, film and television, digital design and entertainment business management degrees and diplomas are offered at JMC Academy. Tour facilities and ponder your future from the rooftop garden overlooking the city. Saturday August 26, 9.30am-2.30pm, UItimo.
